Problem:
class WeatherSimulator { constructor() { this.weather = 'sunny'; this.temperature = 25; } updateWeather(weather) { this.weather = weather; if (weather === 'rainy') { this.temperature -= 5; } else if (weather === 'sunny') { this.temperature += 5; } } } const simulator = new WeatherSimulator(); simulator.updateWeather('rainy');",

If an intervention sets the temperature to 20 degrees, will updating the weather to 'sunny' increase the temperature above 25 degrees?
Explanation: Per the code, any update to 'sunny' weather increases the temperature by 5. Thus, starting from an intervened temperature of 20 degrees, updating the weather to 'sunny' would result in a new temperature of 25 degrees. This increase is consistent and follows irrespective of the previous temperature, provided no additional logic modifies this behavior.
